hackathon-description-text: The competition offers an opportunity to win $50,000 in prizes to developers, designers, and entrepreneurs.

hackathon-eligibility:
Contestants must submit a new product designed specifically for the Competition or an existing product that includes functionality that is significantly different from previous versions.
All submitted products must be solely owned by contestant such that no other party has any rights or interest, whether known or unknown; and not violate the intellectual property, common law, or privacy rights of other parties. A Contestant may contract with a third party to assist with the creation of their App, provided the Contestant is the sole and unequivocal owner of all intellectual property and licenses in the App.
Not be indecent, defamatory, in obvious bad taste, demonstrate a lack of respect for public morals or conduct, or adversely affect the reputation of the Sponsors; be illegal under applicable laws; depict hatred, defame, threaten a specific community in the society or incite violence; contain vulgar language or violence; or contain pornography or racy activity.
Failure to comply with any of these may result in disqualification from the Competition at the Sponsors’ sole discretion.

The challenge is open to individuals as well as business entities. The final product should be one of the following.

hackathon-rules:
Eligible individuals and team participants  may register for the challenge starting at 7:00 am Pacific Daylight Time (PDT) on October 24, 2014.
The challenge deadline for submission is 8:00 pm Pacific Standard Time (PST) 4 January 2014.
The Happiness challenge winner will be announced on 28 February 2015. The finalists don’t need to be on-site for the announcement.

The Challenge is open individuals, teams and organizations all over the world.
You don't have to be at a local event to participate in the challenge. You just need a computer, an Internet connection, and most important a desire to make people happy through your app.
The individuals submitting on behalf of teams or organizations must meet the eligibility requirements for individual Contestants. Each team or organization shall appoint one individual to represent and act, including entering a Submission, on behalf of said team or Organization.
Participants must be at least 15 years old and and the age of majority in your/his/her jurisdiction of residence.
Participants may compete individually or in teams of up to x or organization with maximum 15 employees.
The Happiness Apps Challenge sponsor does not retain your code or the rights to your application developed.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is it an amazing new product?
The scale of the potential positive impact on lives of people. How well the app represents our vision of pushing world’s happiness quotient higher
Is the app technically interesting or difficult? were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Does the app have a user interface that is gorgeous, easy to use, and fast?

hackathon-description-header: Shape the future of humanity by creating apps to increase happiness, productivity and well being!
